scenes.description: You arrive at a small cliffside village where a single lantern glows by the sea.

templates.happy: Even though you are already in a good mood, the gentle glow of the lantern feels like a friendly hello in the night.
templates.sad: You feel heavy and a bit hollow inside, but the warm orange light of the lantern looks like it has been waiting just for you.
templates.angry: Your thoughts are still tense and restless, yet the soft lantern light refuses to argue, simply shining with quiet patience.
templates.disgust: You feel off and uncomfortable, but the lantern's steady glow seems clean and simple, like a safe spot away from everything.
templates.fear: The night feels a little too big and too dark, but the lantern shines like a tiny promise that you are not alone here.
templates.surprised: You did not expect anyone to be awake at this hour, but the lantern blinks calmly through the dark, as if it knew you would come.
templates.neutral: You notice the single lantern burning by the sea, its light moving gently with the breeze.

options.text: Walk up to the lantern keeper and say hello.
Sit quietly near the lantern and watch the waves.

scenes.description: You stand beside the old lantern keeper, who looks at you with kind, tired eyes.

templates.happy: The keeper smiles softly. Your own light mood seems to brighten the lantern as you chat about small things that feel strangely important.
templates.sad: The keeper listens more than he speaks, nodding slowly as you share as much or as little as you want. His voice is low, calm, and never hurried.
templates.angry: The keeper does not flinch at your sharp words. He simply lets them pass like waves against stone, answering with simple, steady sentences.
templates.disgust: The keeper notices your unease and avoids difficult topics, instead pointing out the clean night air and the gentle rhythm of the waves below.
templates.fear: The keeper talks about how the lantern has survived every storm. His words are gentle, reminding you that nights always give way to mornings.
templates.surprised: The keeper seems to know more about how you feel than you told him, finishing your thoughts with quiet, reassuring comments.
templates.neutral: The keeper tells you simple stories about ships, tides and how he always lights the lantern at dusk and puts it out at dawn.

options.text: Ask the keeper to walk with you along the cliff.
Stay by the lantern and simply listen to him talk.

scenes.description: You sit where you can see both the lantern and the dark sea below.

templates.happy: You feel pleasantly heavy and relaxed, as if the day is finally allowed to be over. The sea sounds like a slow, friendly song.
templates.sad: Your chest still hurts a bit, but the waves keep moving, and the lantern keeps shining, and it becomes easier to breathe.
templates.angry: The crash of the waves slowly matches your heartbeat, and the steady lantern light gives your thoughts something calm to land on.
templates.disgust: The night air feels cleaner than anything that happened today. The lantern, the sea, the cliffside all feel quietly separate from your worries.
templates.fear: You keep looking at the edges of the cliff and the shadows, but nothing moves except the water and the safe, constant glow of the lantern.
templates.surprised: You are surprised by how quickly your body starts to relax here, as if the bench, the sea and the soft light have been rehearsing this moment.
templates.neutral: You sit, listening to the sea and watching the lantern flicker. Time passes gently without you needing to do anything at all.

options.text: Let your eyes close and drift toward sleep.
Stand up, thank the lantern keeper, and head home.

scenes.description: You and the keeper walk a short path along the cliff, the lantern swinging gently in his hand.

templates.happy: You share small jokes and memories, the path ahead glowing just enough for every step to feel sure and easy.
templates.sad: You walk mostly in silence, but it is the kind of silence that makes the cliff, the sea and your thoughts feel a little lighter.
templates.angry: The cool air and firm ground under your feet slowly smooth the sharper corners of your mood as the lantern light moves in a gentle rhythm.
templates.disgust: Away from noise and messy thoughts, you simply follow the small circle of light, feeling the world narrow into something manageable.
templates.fear: The keeper stays close, keeping the lantern between you and the dark. Each step proves the path is safe, and you start to believe it.
templates.surprised: You did not expect such a simple walk to feel meaningful, yet every wave and distant light seems to carry a quiet message.
templates.neutral: The walk is calm and short. The lantern shows each stone and curve of the path, nothing more and nothing less.

options.text: Return to the lantern post and sit again.
Say goodbye and walk back toward the village lights.

scenes.description: You allow yourself to rest at last.

templates.happy: You fall asleep with a small smile, the lantern's glow still warm behind your closed eyes.
templates.sad: Sleep comes softly, not as an escape, but as a gentle promise that tomorrow might feel a little less heavy.
templates.angry: Your thoughts quiet just enough for you to rest, held by the steady rhythm of waves and light.
templates.disgust: You feel cleaner inside, as if the night air and the sea washed away the worst of the day before you sleep.
templates.fear: The last thing you notice is the lantern glow, constant and kind, before you finally drift off.
templates.surprised: You are surprised by how safe and calm you feel as you drift into sleep.
templates.neutral: You simply become more and more relaxed until sleep feels like the most natural next step.

scenes.description: You say goodbye to the lantern keeper and head back, carrying the calm of the night with you.

templates.happy: You walk away with light steps, as if the night itself had wished you a good tomorrow.
templates.sad: Things are not magically fixed, but your chest feels a little less tight as you walk toward home.
templates.angry: You still remember what bothered you, but it no longer fills your whole mind. You have room to breathe.
templates.disgust: The quiet path and cool air leave your thoughts clearer than they were when you arrived.
templates.fear: With every step away, you feel a bit braver, as if the lantern's courage is still walking beside you.
templates.surprised: You did not expect a simple lantern and an old keeper to help this much, yet here you are, calmer than before.
templates.neutral: You head home, feeling simply okay, which is exactly enough for tonight.
